codelists.definition: Purpose of a specific analysis result described in ADaM analysis results metadata.
codelists.name: Analysis Purpose

terms.definition: Exploratory measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are exploratory of the study.

The primary measurement(s) or observation(s) used to measure the effect of experimental variables in a study, or for observational studies, to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment. These are the outcome measures used to assess the primary objective(s).

Other key measures that will be used to evaluate the intervention(s) or, for observational studies, that are a focus of the study. These are the outcome measures used to assess the secondary objective(s).

codelists.definition: Reason for reporting a specific analysis result described in ADaM analysis results metadata.
codelists.name: Analysis Reason

terms.definition: The analysis was triggered by findings in the data.
The analysis has been requested by a regulatory agency.
The analysis is specified in a protocol.
The analysis is specified in a statistical analysis plan.
terms.preferredTerm: Analysis Specified in Statistical Analysis Plan

codelists.definition: Date Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a date value.
codelists.name: Date Imputation Flag
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Date Imputation Flag Terminology

terms.definition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.
Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.
Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.

codelists.definition: Derivation Type: Analysis value derivation method.
codelists.name: Derivation Type

terms.definition: Average: A data derivation technique which calculates a subject's average value over a defined set of records.
Best Case: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the best possible outcome.
Baseline Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's nonmissing baseline observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Best Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's best-case nonmissing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Endpoint: A data derivation technique which calculates a subject's analysis end point value.
Interpolation: A method of imputation involving a missing value that is between known values and is estimated by a function of those known values.
Last Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's previous nonmissing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Maximum: A data derivation technique which calculates a subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
Minimum: A data derivation technique which calculates a subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
Maximum Likelihood: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with estimates that maximize the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
Mean of Other Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
terms.preferredTerm: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Mean Observed Value in a Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
terms.preferredTerm: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's next-to-last nonmissing value.
terms.preferredTerm: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Screening Observation Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's nonmissing screening observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Worst Case: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the worst possible outcome.
Worst Observed Value Carried Forward: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the subject's worst-case nonmissing observation.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

terms.definition: Worst Observed Value in a Group: A data imputation technique which populates missing values with the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
terms.preferredTerm: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

codelists.definition: Parameter Type: Indicates whether the parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.
codelists.name: Parameter Type

terms.definition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.

codelists.definition: Indicates the status of the subject in the trial.
codelists.name: Subject Trial Status
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Subject Trial Status Terminology

terms.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)

codelists.definition: Time Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a time value.
codelists.name: Time Imputation Flag
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Time Imputation Flag Terminology

terms.definition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.
Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.
Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.

description: CDISC Controlled Terminology for ADaM is the set of CDISC-developed or CDISC-adopted standard expressions (values) used with data items within CDISC-defined ADaM datasets.
label: ADaM Controlled Terminology Package 28 Effective 2016-12-16
name: ADaM CT 2016-12-16
source: ADaM Controlled Terminology developed by the CDISC Terminology Team in collaboration with the National Cancer Institute's Enterprise Vocabulary Services (EVS)
